prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: As you can see, it's covered in blood.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and each testimony to see where they might clash.

First, looking at the testimonies. Testimony 0 says there's more incriminating evidence. Testimony 1 mentions the defendant's costume. Testimony 2 points out blood on it. Testimony 3 claims the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back.

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 11 is Maya's Costume with blood splatters and a bullet hole. Testimony 2 is about blood on the costume, which aligns with Evidence 11, so they don't contradict.

Testimony 3 says the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back. Let's check the evidence for this. Evidence 8 is Dr. Grey's autopsy report, stating he was stabbed and shot. Evidence 9 is the pistol with two shots, and Evidence 10 is a knife with Maya's fingerprints. So, Maya used both a knife and a gun, which suggests she attacked Grey, who might not have been able to defend himself, especially if he was already stabbed.

Wait, but Testimony 3 says the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back. If Grey was stabbed and then shot, he might have been incapacitated after the stabbing, making the shooting an attack on someone who couldn't fight back. That seems to support Testimony 3.

But I'm supposed to find a contradiction. Maybe another angle. Let me check other testimonies. Testimony 0 mentions more incriminating evidence, but I don't see a direct contradiction there.

Wait, looking at Testimony 3 again. It says the defendant attacked someone not fighting back. But looking at Evidence 8, Grey was stabbed and then shot. The stabbing might have been the initial attack, and the shooting was the final blow. But if Grey was already down from the stabbing, the shooting would be attacking someone who wasn't fighting back. So Testimony 3 and Evidence 8 actually support each other, not contradict.

Hmm, maybe I'm missing something. Let me look for other evidence. Evidence 10 is a knife with Maya's fingerprints, and Evidence 9 is a pistol with her fingerprints too. So Maya used both, which supports Testimony 3's claim of an attack.

Wait, perhaps another testimony and evidence pair. Testimony 1 says the costume is the defendant's, which matches Evidence 11. No contradiction there.

Wait, maybe looking at Testimony 0 and Evidence 14. Testimony 0 says there's more incriminating evidence, but Evidence 14 is the Sacred Urn, which was broken by Pearl. I don't see a direct contradiction there.

Wait, maybe Testimony 3 and Evidence 8 don't contradict, but perhaps another pair does. Let me check Testimony 3 again. It says the defendant attacked someone not fighting back. But if the autopsy shows both stab and gunshot wounds, perhaps the attack was more aggressive than just one blow, which might not contradict.

Wait, perhaps another angle. Testimony 3 says the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back, implying the victim was defenseless. But if the victim was stabbed and then shot, maybe the victim was already incapacitated after the stabbing, making the shooting an attack on someone who couldn't fight back. So Testimony 3 aligns with Evidence 8, not contradicting.

Wait, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me think differently. Testimony 3 says the defendant attacked someone not fighting back. But if the victim had a chance to fight back, that would contradict. But according to the evidence, Grey was stabbed and shot, which suggests he didn't fight back. So Testimony 3 is supported by Evidence 8, not contradicted.

Wait, perhaps looking at another testimony. Testimony 0 says there's more incriminating evidence. Maybe Evidence 0 is the Attorney's Badge, which is not incriminating. So perhaps Testimony 0 is contradicted by Evidence 0? That doesn't make sense.

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3 is contradicted by another evidence. Wait, if the defendant used a knife and a gun, perhaps the victim was able to fight back, but the evidence shows he was stabbed and shot, which might indicate he couldn't. So maybe no contradiction.

Wait, perhaps another approach. Let's look for an evidence that directly opposes a testimony. For example, Testimony 3 says the victim wasn't fighting back, but maybe an evidence shows the victim did fight back.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 4 is a folding screen with a bullet hole. Maybe that suggests a struggle? Or perhaps Evidence 5 is a black key, not sure.

Wait, maybe Testimony 3 is contradicted by Evidence 8. Because Evidence 8 shows that Grey was stabbed and then shot, which might indicate that he was attacked twice, but perhaps the first attack (stabbing) was when he was fighting back, and the second (shooting) was when he wasn't. Or maybe the stabbing was the initial attack, and the shooting was the final blow when he was down. So Testimony 3's claim that the victim wasn't fighting back might be supported by the evidence, not contradicted.

Hmm, I'm getting stuck. Let me try to think of it differently. Maybe the testimony about the defendant's costume being covered in blood (Testimony 2) is contradicted by the evidence. But Evidence 11 shows blood on the costume, so they agree.

Wait, perhaps Testimony 3 is contradicted by another evidence. Let me check Evidence 10, the knife with Maya's fingerprints. If Maya used the knife, and the victim was stabbed, perhaps the victim tried to fight back, but the evidence doesn't show that. So maybe Testimony 3 is not contradicted.

Wait, maybe I'm missing something. Let me look at all testimonies and evidences again.

Testimony 3: Defendant attacked someone not fighting back.

Evidence 8: Autopsy shows stabbed and shot.

So, if the victim was stabbed first, perhaps he was fighting back, but then shot when he couldn't. Or maybe the stabbing was the only attack, and the shooting was unnecessary. But I'm not sure if that's a contradiction.

Wait, perhaps the testimony says the victim wasn't fighting back at all, but the evidence shows that the victim was stabbed, implying some struggle. Maybe that's a contradiction.

Wait, no, because being stabbed doesn't necessarily mean the victim was fighting back. It could be a surprise attack.

Hmm, I'm not entirely sure, but I think the correct contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 8. Because Testimony 3 claims the victim wasn't fighting back, but Evidence 8 shows that the victim was stabbed, which might indicate some resistance.

Wait, but the autopsy report says he was stabbed in the chest and then shot at point-blank. So the stabbing could have been the initial attack, and the shooting when he was down. So the victim might not have been able to fight back after the stabbing. Therefore, Testimony 3 and Evidence 8 don't contradict; they support each other.

Wait, maybe another pair. Let's look at Testimony 0: "Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence." This could be contradicted if there's no more incriminating evidence. But looking at the evidence list, there are several incriminating ones like the knife, gun, bloodied costume, etc. So Testimony 0 is supported, not contradicted.

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 1 and Evidence 11 don't contradict because they both refer to the costume.

Wait, perhaps I'm overcomplicating. Let me think of it this way: the question is to find one pair that contradicts. The most likely is Testimony 3 and Evidence 8. But I'm not entirely sure. Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3 is contradicted by another evidence.

Wait, another thought: Testimony 3 says the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back. If the victim was shot at point-blank after being stabbed, perhaps the victim was already down, so Testimony 3 is correct. So no contradiction.

Wait, maybe I'm wrong. Perhaps the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 10. Because Evidence 10 is a knife, which is a close-range weapon, implying a struggle, contradicting Testimony 3's claim that the victim wasn't fighting back.

So, if Testimony 3 says the victim wasn't fighting back, but the use of a knife suggests a struggle, that would be a contradiction.

Yes, that makes sense. Using a knife usually involves some proximity and possible struggle, implying the victim might have fought back, which contradicts Testimony 3's claim that the victim wasn't fighting back.

So, the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 and Evidence 10.
</think>

Person: Gumshoe

Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. The task is to identify a pair consisting of one evidence and one testimony that contradict each other. I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies provided, and I need to analyze them to find such a conflicting pair.

First, I'll go through the evidences and testimonies to understand their contents. Starting with the evidences, I notice several key pieces that relate to the crime scene and the events surrounding Dr. Turner Grey's death. For instance, Evidence 8 is Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report, which states that he was stabbed in the chest and then shot in the forehead at point-blank range, with gunpowder residue around the bullet hole. This indicates that the shooting was at very close range.

Looking at the testimonies, Testimony 3 says, "The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed." This suggests that Dr. Grey attempted to shoot but missed because of the close proximity. However, the autopsy report clearly states that there was a point-blank gunshot wound to the forehead with gunpowder residue, meaning the shot didn't miss—it hit the victim directly.

This contradiction is significant because if the shot was fired at point-blank range and hit the victim, as per the autopsy, then Testimony 3 claiming the shot missed is false. Therefore, Evidence 8 and Testimony 3 contradict each other.
</think>
